We cater for all abilities whether you are a competant climber or have never seen a mountain before.

name: Muay Thai
description: Mauy Thai and MMA. We teach Thai boxing and MMA and will be competing against other universities and in other competitions. It's fun and easy going but if you are serious about it then there is a fight team.

name: Music Production Society
description: Whether you love music, want to meet new people, learn a few engineering skills or love composing, this is the society for you!

name: Nepalis United at the
description: The group has been unofficially formed to unite the ever growing number of Nepalese people at the University of Southampton and if it gets approved officially, it is going to give a platform for Nepalese people at the University to embrace and preserve our culture. It is also going to give an opportunity to showcase the variety of talents from dancing to sports to the rest of the University.

name: Netball
description: Southampton University Netball Club have 4 teams competing in the BUCS Western Conference League. We pride ourselves on the high standard of netball we play and the girls' commitment to the club. We also have themed socials every week, an annual tour in Spain and also organise fundraising events throughout the year. If you want to get involved in SUNC look us up on facebook or email us.

name: Nightline
description: Nightline is a confidential information and listening service open from 8pm - 8am during term time. We are run by students for students.

name: NOC
description: NOC SOC is a group for anyone studying Geology, Oceanography, Geophysics and Marine Biology at Southampton Uni. We will be in charge of all hoody orders, fundraisers and socials. Our aim is to create a closer atmosphere among all students who study down at the oceanography centre.

name: Nordic Society
description: We are a small society welcoming anybody from Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway & Iceland, and anyone else just interested in Nordic culture. We meet around once a month for socials including pub crawls, film nights, food tasting sessions and much more. We look forward to seeing you soon!

name: Northern Ireland Society
description: What about ye? Aaaaahhh Northern Ireland...the home of miserable weather, Tayto crisps, amateur politics and Liam Neeson. Our society exists as a meeting place for N.Irish students at Southampton Uni, but it's also very much for non-NI students who want to come along and soak up a bit of what makes our wee country so great...we plan to organise social get-togethers at least once a month, and the craic will be mighty. If you don't want to get involved, you must be away in the head!

name: Nursing and Midwifery Society
description: The University of Southamptons Nursing and Midwifery Society (NAMSOC) is currently one of the largest societies running on campus. The committee aim to provide both academic and moral support for students throughout the duration of their course....alongside organising regular and varied social events! We aim to bring a personalised social experience to fit around the busy schedule NAMSOC members contend with. NAMSOC collaborate with other societies and have big plans for the future; it really is impossible not to get involved! With charity events, sports teams, supportive coffee mornings, big nights out, Summer and Christmas balls, fancy dress, BBQs and much, much more there is never a shortage of events going on. And did we mention we have hoodies? You can follow NAMSOC on twitter, keep up to date with all social events on our public Facebook page, and gain academic or moral support via our email and private Facebook group. Your committee is there for you!

name: Organ Donation Society
description: At the Organ Donation Awareness Society our aim is to encourage students to join the organ donation through education and awareness events.Anyone is welcome to come to the meetings and we would love new members help out at any future events! Email suoda@soton.ac.uk to be added to the mailing list.

name: Oxfam Society
description: Southampton Universitys very own OXFAM society.  Oxfam works with others to find lasting solutions to poverty and suffering. your committee: PRESIDENT - CLAIRE MOFFAT VICE PRESIDENT - CHARLOTTE GAULD SECRETARY - ELEANORE HEASLEY TREASURER - HAZEL CUTTELL. PUBLICITY REP: HANNAH LIVETT SOCIAL SECS: ROSIE FENDER  The aim of this society is to try and get across the message of Oxfam and what we do. So what do we do? Oxfam does many things such as events, fundraisers, festivals and much more. We are trying to promote many things such as international development, eradicate poverty, increase education, and improve things such as health, schooling and living standards. What will we do as a society? The main thing is what YOU the members of the society want to do. Many people want to learn more about different things, or focus on particular issues that we face today, so instead of telling you WHAT TO DO (people hate that) we are going to WORK IT OUT AS A SOCIETY TOGETHER.  Any ideas? email OXSOC or message any of the committee :) email: oxsocsoton@gmail.com or FIND US ON FACEBOOK!

name: Paintball
description: We are the paintball club! Full of energy (even at 8AM on a Sunday morning) and with a passion for sport, we're there to help everyone play paintball cheaply. From club socials to our own trips, we'll be haggling the prices and making paintball cheap for everyone. Of course, you don't have to be a die hard paintballer to join our club. So, if you'd like a bit of a laugh, a fun day out, and to meet a load of new friends, then why not come and see what our club can do.If you want to join our mailing list, please subscribe on our members website and *not* on SUSU.org, as we don't use much of their groups features - Go to https://members.supac.org.uk/subscribe

name: Pakistan Society
description: Pakistan Society aims to bring the culture of Pakistan to Southampton, to attract a diverse member base comprising of both local and international students. Moreover, we aim to collaborate with other societies to organise events on a large scale, a recent example was the Eid dinner in which four other societies. We also aim to represent Pakistan and make sure students specially coming from a Pakistani background feel at home and to help them with whatever queries they might have and to guide them in the right way if/as needed.

name: Performing Arts
description: Performing Arts is responsible for all 32 of the performance related societies which fall under the areas of: Dance, Music, Theatrical and Technical

name: Persian
description: Persian society aims to gather Iranian students together and facilitate the communication. Also Persian Society strives to introduce the culture (music, art, food and ) and history of Iran to people from different background. The society tries to materialise these objectives through some cultural and social activities

name: Philharmonic Choir
description: SuPhil is a non auditioning choir, and is the student section of the Southampton City Philharmonic Choir. We aim to make music live in Southampton . We sing classical choral pieces, and have 2-3 concerts a year. Our professional conductor takes weekly rehearsals with a professional accompanist, and the choir is over 180 strong, with the student section being approximately 30+.The mix of the two choirs gives us a unique blend of youthful voices with those of more experienced singers, as well as offering a once in a lifetime opportunity to perform musical works on a massive scale in an ensemble of over 180 voices

name: Philosophy Society
description: PhilSoc aims to allow students with an interest in philosophy to meet one another, regardless of whether or not they study philosophy. This has both social an academic aspects, with activities ranging from trips abroad to academic talks to nights out.

name: Photographic Society
description: Whether you just like to dabble or are serious about photography you are welcome here. We run regular subsided trips and photowalks as well as meet ups with other photographic societies around the country.Our weekly meetings on a Thursday cover a wide variety of topics, from talks by professional through to hands on experience with studio equipment.For people more experienced in photography, our events team is well worth joining if you wish to get good experience with shooting balls, nightclubs, sports events, gigs or even weddings.New for this year we have a fully equipped photographic studio with integrated black and white darkroom. We also stock a wide range of films at discounted prices.If you're new to photography, do not fear, we offer a way range of support and advice on how to take great photos. We also have a selection of cameras that you are welcome to borrow and try out.Best of all, you get all this for just 15 a year!

name: Physics Society
description: Physoc is a society primarily concerned with the welfare of all physics undergraduates at the University of Southampton, though our doors are open to all who apply. We organise academic & careers talks, socials (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic), sports events, outreach programmes, balls, and more, to ensure that our members enjoy and make the most of their time at university. Our society is not confined to undergraduates, but includes postgrads, post-docs, and staff.

name: Piano Society
description: Pianosoc is a friendly environment for all people interested in listening to or performing piano of any genre, at any level. We generally discuss all things piano-related and even have a weekly dose of a brief introduction to a new pianist, to broaden our scope of the piano world for members for which it has not been so exposed to.We try to spread the love of piano music. Increase interest for the piano. Make more use of pianos lying around on campus by putting together concerts and playing times, perhaps even one day funding our own piano. We want to be able to offer members who want to pick up piano playing during their time at university classes, for all sorts of levels, ranging from people who have never touched a piano before to those who just want to continue practicing. Our society will cater adequately for pianists of all degrees, something no other society does  especially for those piano players who aren't at a high enough level to join the university orchestra or at a low enough level to forget about piano playing altogether. We also offer piano lessons for both groups and individual ranging from beginners to advance levels. There is a definite demand for Pianosoc; many people play the piano but never really get to meet other pianists since an individual activity. We provide a network of pianists, teachers and people who just have a general love for piano music.

name: Picnic Society
description: We organize and carry out picnics with the aim of bringing people on different courses, of different ages, with different interests and from different backgrounds together.

name: Poetry Society
description: A society dedicated to the art of poetry. Whether it be performance or page, there's something for everyone in our comfortable environment. We hold weekly meetings with various themes to challenge your writing skills, further your reading and allow discussions to flow.

name: Poker Society
description: Pokersoc provides regular poker tournaments for the enjoyment of all members giving students a chance to win reasonable amounts of money with no risk of losing large amounts. Above all, our aim is to provide a comfortable atmosphere where all students are welcome to come and be sociable, meet new people, and have a good time.

name: Pole Dancing Society
description: Our main aim is to help people keep fit and have fun. Pole dancing is a great way to keep active, gain strength and become more athletic as well as meeting likeminded people. We're just here to have fun!

name: Polish Society
description: Polish Society, commonly known as PolSoc, was established to cultivate and share our traditions, and to promote our culture and history within all Southampton University Students. We do that by organizing variety of events, which primary goal is to integrate and have fun together. We are happy to provide freshers with help to make their start more comfortable in a new environment. Dont be afraid to join our society if youre not Polish! It is a great idea to explore new culture and make a lot of friends who know how to party!

name: Politics Association
description: Hey,We're SUPA (Southampton University Politics Association) and we are here for those studying politics and anyother student's who wish to get involved in politics!

name: Polo
description: Southampton University Polo Club is an active, friendly club that welcomes all standards, from seasoned players to complete beginners! We play at Watership Down and Druid's Lodge Polo Club every week and compete in SUPA National Competitions, in the Druid's Lodge University League and have numerous Friendly Matches throughout the year.

name: Pottery Society
description: Hello! We are Southampton University Pottery Society. We meet every Thursday evening during term time 7-9pm at Cantell Maths and Computing College (5 mins from Glen Eyre Halls- you can find this on Google maps or alternatively get in touch through our Facebook page and someone will be happy to meet you on campus and walk over). Any level is welcome and you are free to make what you like. We have a lovely teacher, Helen, who is more than happy to help if you want to get the hang of the basics or want to try something new. We are a members only society due to high demand. Taster sessions at the beginning of semester 1 is the best time to come and try out the society for 3.50 before deciding whether its for you. If you want to get in touch our Facebook page is linked above or you can email us on potterysociety@soton.ac.uk.Hope to see you soon :)

name: Private Rented JCR
description: For students living in private rented accommodation in their first year

name: Psychosoc
description: We are a society for students studying Psychology. Our aim is to help freshers make the transition to university life, provide a fun setting for students to meet people on their course, have a community where any course issues can be discussed and run events and trips useful to members studying.

name: RAG
description: The RAG committee is always hard at work planning new fundraising events and schemes, and helping others plan theirs. Each year we kick off with RAGfest  a festival of fundraising during Freshers Week. Throughout the year we organise awesome social events such as the RAG Week, and offer fantastic opportunities like climbing mountains or getting your kit off for the annual RAG calendar.This year we are fundraising for 3 charities nominated and voted  for by you guys; Southampton Samaritans, WaterAid and Marrow.Check out our blog for up to date information on everything we're up to!http://susurag.wordpress.com/

name: Real Ale and Cider Society
description: This is a society for ale and cider lovers, to meet up, discuss their favourite drinks, and get to know each other. We aim to encourage the responsible enjoyment of ale and cider. The social events will include trips to breweries, famous pubs and cider houses, as well as visits to local pubs, pub games competitions, and BBQs

name: Riding
description: The Riding Club provides all types of riding at every level. We arrange a number of activities, ranging from socials and holidays to BUCS competitions. We aim to offer riding to everyone regardless of whether you have ridden on national teams or have never sat on a horse before!

name: Rifle
description: SURC is one of the most successful University shooting clubs in the country, and we welcome new members of all experience levels. We compete both locally and nationally, in both the .22 Smallbore and 7.62mm Fullbore disciplines, and have our own 25 yard indoor range near Wessex Lane. We provide kit (including rifles) and coaching for all members, and those with talent can compete for the university at events such as the BUCS championships, which we have won six out of the last eight years. Get in touch now!

name: Road (Cycling)
description: New to cycling? Experienced racer? Southampton University's Premier Road Cycling Club is here to cater for your every need! Contact: surc@soton.ac.ukhttp://www.southamptonuniversityroadclub.org/Follow us on twitter @surcClubFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/SouthamptonUniversityRoadClub

name: Rock and Metal Music Society
description: Rocksoc is  a social society where people with like-minded music tastes can meet. We organise monthly events in Bar 2 (Subliminal) in which there are rock/metal DJs and live bands playing 8-12. We also have frequent socials in The Hobbit, Dungeon, Shooting Star and more. Popular annual events include the board games night and the Guitar Hero Tournament.There is no membership fee so feel free to turn up and rock out.\m/

name: Romanian
description: The Romanian Society, affectionately known as RoSoc, is a student run society at the University of Southampton, officially affiliated with the Southampton University Student Union. Founded in 2010, its aims are to help bring students together, make new friends, look out for each other and have fun. We hope to aid new comers at the University and create a sense of belonging, provide great experiences to all of RoSoc's members and continue attracting new people in the years to come.

name: Rotaract Club
description: Rotaract is an international organization of young professionals and students ages 18 to 30 that are committed to service and leadership in their communities and abroad. Established in 1968 by Rotary International, Rotaract is a global network of 200,000 young people who are changing the world with 8,700 clubs in over 170 countries.In Southampton we are a university based club. We organize among other official meetings and presentations every other Saturday at 11am at the Highfield Campus, socials, networking, trips to interesting places, summer exchange travel abroad, community volunteering and fundraising. We work together with other Rotaract and Rotary clubs.Our activities are open to all people. Join us on facebook to get more information.

name: RSPCA Society
description: An RSPCA charity-focused society. A society in which we aim to raise money and awareness for the charity with lots of campaigning and fundraising.

name: Rugby (Ladies)
description: SUWRFC welcomes new and experienced players. Come along and give rugby a try! Training: Mondays 7.30-9.30pm at Wide Lane Matches: Wednesday afternoons Socials: Wednesday evenings

name: Rugby (Mens)
description: We are one of the biggest and most successful clubs at the Uni, and widely encourage freshers to join - look out for our stall at the Freshers Fair! Everyone is welcome.Coached by ex-Gloucester and Samoan international, Junior Paramore, competition for places is strong. We field 3 teams, with the 1st team playing in the competitive BUCS league, Western 1A.

name: Russian Speaking Society
description: Our aim is to unite all Russian speaking students, help them to settle down in the new environment and of course we are going to organise various socials, parties and journeys.

name: Salsa Society
description: If you want to get those hips shaking and feet moving to those sultry rhythms of Salsa, come down and get involved with the hottest society in Southampton! We run weekly lessons taught by our professional teachers. We hold classes for a range of abilities including beginners, improvers and advanced.Lessons:Thursday 7-8pm: Beginners with Marcus and Elaine                     2 (1.50 with membership)Thursday 8-10pm: LA intermediate with Marcus and Elaine                   3 (2 with membership card)Friday 8-10pm: Cuban intermediate with Will                    3 (2 with membership card)FREEEEEEE Taster sessions:Thursday 10th Oct 7-8pm: Beginners Thursday 10th Oct 8-10pm: LA intermediate Friday 11th Oct 8-10pm: Cuban intermediate Normal lessons resume on Thursday 17th and Friday 18th Oct. No need to bring a partner along, there are plenty to go around! Hope to see you soon!SalsaSoc

name: Shaolin Temple Kung Fu Club
description: Shaolin Temple Kung Fu is taught by Shifu Yan Xin, a 34th generation monk from the Shaolin temple in China. He is extremely experienced in teaching martial arts and has performed in the Shaolin Wheel of Life Tour. The club practices all aspects of Kung Fu including taolu (forms), sanda, self-defence and weapons. We also do a lot of fun acrobatic moves from an early stage such as butterfly and tornado kicks.

name: Shorinji Kempo
description: Shorinji Kempo is a Japanese martial art for self-defence, aiming to improve health, fitness, confidence and concentration. Shorinji Kempo incorporates punching, kicking, blocking, grappling and throwing. It relies less on strength than it does on speed, technique and accuracy, utilising knowledge of 'nerve points', and an understanding of how the body can be manipulated to achieve maximum effect with minimal effort.

name: Showstoppers
description: Showstoppers is a Performing Arts Musical Theatre Society. We offer members the opportunity to take part in numerous shows throughout the year including a Fresher only musical at the beginning of the year and the chance to take a show to the Edinburgh Fringe. We also run fortnightly meetings for members to improve skills within the musical theatre genre as well as Cabaret nights providing chances to perform outside of shows.

name: Sign Language Society
description: We promote the use of BSL, offering professional and non-professional classes for people who want to learn the language. We also aim to be a point of contact and social events for people who already know some BSL

name: Sinfonietta
description: 'The University of Southampton Sinfonietta (Sinf) is the universitys only chamber music ensemble. It has quickly developed an outstanding reputation for providing top quality live music from a wide-ranging repertoire. The orchestra is made up from some of the universitys most talented musicians who are auditioned at the start of the year, and is under the direction of guest professional conductor Maxime Tortelier. We aim to produce music of the highest possible quality and perform a minimum of three concerts a year, often with professional soloists

name: Singapore Society
description: The University of Southampton Singapore Society (SingSoc) is a place for students, Singaporean and non Singaporean alike, to immerse in uniquely Singaporean culture, and engage in a familiar community through casual and annually organised social and professional events.We are a diverse society comprising of students from varied backgrounds and nationalities that include students from Malaysia, Brunei, Hong Kong, China, and the United Kingdom to name a few.Our primary aim is to provide help and specific knowledge to all members, as well as new or exchange students to the University of Southampton from Singapore. We hope to help ease the transition from the comforts of home to the independent overseas student life with tips, advice and personal experiences. In addition, we aim to provide members and students who are interested in Singapore's culture with more detailed and personal information on our homeland, especially to students who wish to pursue an exchange semester in Singapore.As a society we organise social trips within the UK, dinners commemorating various festive occasions and our annual Summer Chalet BBQ in Singapore. We build bonds with our members through regular sport sessions, and both inter and intra University sporting tournaments. We also constantly update members on any events organised by the SingSocs of other UK Universities. As our society liaises with companies and government departments, we periodically inform our members of career opportunities offered by establishments in Singapore so as to provide them with assistance in career development.

name: Ski and Snowboard
description: With over 600 members, Southampton University Ski and Snowboard Club is the largest club in the Athletic Union and one of the leading university snowsports clubs in the country! This means huge holidays during the Christmas and Easter holidays, epic socials and awesome race and freestyle teams! The club is open to everyone from complete beginners to pro-racers so be sure to give it a go during your time at Southampton!

name: SKIP
description: SKIP Southampton Charity is a branch off the national charity SKIP (Students for Kids International Projects)SKIP Southampton Society promotes its work around the campus, recruits volunteers at the bun fight and fundraises for its project.

name: Skydive
description: A place for people of any experience level to join the world of competitive skydiving

name: Snooker and Pool
description: The snooker club has fantastic facilities with direct access to four snooker tables, two dedicated solely to members. The team consistently competes at a high level in national tournaments, with its own internal league and intends to compete at pool this year. The club is very active with members of all abilities and is happy to embrace new members

name: Social Sciences Society
description: A society for those studying sociology, social policy, criminology, anthropology, crim/psych and general pathwayWe keep you up to date with all the latest events on your course, from sports to socials to book sales, as well as offering an environment for you to get in touch with those studying the same as you, so that you can ask any questions and discuss any issues.

name: Society for the appreciation of Permaculture, Allotments and Mud
description: SAPAM is a social group that caters for students interested in gardening, with a bias towards growing food as well as learning/teaching permaculture. The main aim of the society is to set up its own allotment space where students set up their own plot/bed and grow their own veggies.

name: Soton Navs
description: Soton Navs exists as a society to provide opportunities for students to explore and think about the Christian faith. We aim to do this by creating a welcoming environment which promotes discussion and friendship.  We  hope that by providing this warm environment to all students, whatever their faith background, that they would feel welcomed into the group.

name: Hub
description: Southampton Hub is transforming students involvement with social and environmental challenges in Southampton and around the world. We are a catalyst, facilitating more students to do more, more effectively and for longer. We are part of Student Hubs, a national network with the mission to create a culture change in UK universities so that student-powered social change becomes the norm and not the exception  inspiring socially active citizens for life.We inspire students about their power and potential to shape a better world; connect them to opportunities to make a difference during their time at university, and support them to become civic leaders in their future lives and careers.

name: Marrow
description: Southampton Marrow works with Anthony Nolan to recruit potential donors onto their stem cell register. Marrow is a voluntary student organisation  which helps to arrange donor recruitment clinics in universities, and raises charitable funds to run these events.  See further info on marrow donation at http://www.anthonynolan.org/and donate money at http://www.justgiving.com/sotonmarrow

name: Marxist Society
description: Join the University of Southampton Marxist Society if you;-want to know more about Marxism-enjoy interesting discussions with people about philosophy, politics, economics and the world in general-like watching movies/documentaries about politics or history-want to debate and support your own views on Marxism (positive or negative)As Karl Marx once said; ''Philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways; the point is to change it!''

name: Society of Clinical Anatomy
description: Anatomy is the foundation that is essential for medical education. It is a fascinating yet complex subject that we are enthusiastic and passionate about.Our philosophy Encourage and inspire the study of clinical anatomy amongst our peersOur Aims Increase interest and enthusiasm in anatomyEmphasise the clinical importance of anatomyRelate anatomy to clinical practiceProvide a platform to present researchProvide unique teaching and revision seminars (approved by CLAS)To be involved in wider community outreach programs (approved by CLAS)Provide a more holistic look at clinical anatomy by association with other departments within Southampton General Hospital and external organisations

name: Taiwanese Society
description: Our Society is a platform where (1) Taiwanese students can interact, share information and help each other (2) Introducing Taiwans culture to who has interesting towards us. (3) Communicating with other society

name: Archery Club
description: Archery is a sport open to everyone. If you are already an archer just send us an email or turn up to one of our sessions, details can be found on the website.  We run a beginners' course for the first 6 weeks of the academic year and most of our current members learned to shoot while at University.  If you have not completed a beginners' course please contact us for information on local courses. We offer the opportunity for both new and experienced archers to regularly compete; this year our senior team came 4th at the British University Team Championships and 12th at the BUCS Indoors tournament while the novice team came 6th in their category at BUCS Indoors.

name: British Red Cross Group
description: The British Red Cross (BRC) is a volunteer-led humanitarian organisation that helps people in crisis, whoever and wherever they are. The BRC enables vulnerable people at home and overseas to prepare for and respond to emergencies in their own communities.  And when the crisis is over, the BRC helps people recover and move on with their livesSouthampton University BRC Group (SUBRC) connects students/staff to various volunteering opportunities within the BRC whilst creating a social atmosphere for members. SUBRC provides opportunities in Fundraising, teaching Humanitarian Education and Everyday first aid and Event First Aid,  including the necessary training and assessments.Add us on Facebook for more up to date information!

name: Chamber Choir
description: The University of Southampton Chamber Choir is an award winning group made up of 25-30 singers from around the university, ranging in age, background and degrees.The choir is one of the two university auditioned choirs, and is led by conductor and musical director Peter Stobart, singing music within a range of genres, including masses, madrigals, requiems, folk songs and occasionally jazz and pop.We sing at a number of venues each year, recent outings include Portsmouth Cathedral, Mottisfont Abbey and St Michael & All Angels church, Southampton, and tours to Bruges, Bordeaux and Vienna in recent years, as well as a tour to Spain planned for 2014.Rehearsals are held at the University of Southampton's Highfield Campus on Thursday 7.30 - 9.30pm. Being a chamber choir we take on between 25 and 30 members. The Southampton University Chamber Choir forms part of one of the older societies to be affiliated to SUSU (Southampton University's Student's Union). A society in its own right until 2004, SUCC has a reputation for fine singing and a close community spirit.

name: Civil Engineering Society
description: Southampton University Civil Engineering Society (CivSoc) is open to any undergraduate, postgraduate, staff or lecturer at the University of Southampton that is interested in the civil engineering industry (including those not studying civil engineering). We run regular socials, networking opportunities, talks, site visits and trips, as well as promoting events run by both the University of Southampton and professional engineering institutions.Previously students studying Civil Engineering were represented by the Southampton University Engineering Society (SUES). Please see the email sent to "groups@susu.org" dated 21/10/2013 from CivSoc@soton.ac.uk regarding reasons for CivSoc seeking independence from SUES. Attached to the email is a covering letter explaining the reasoning for independence as well as a letter from SUES giving their agreement and approval of the independence.

name: Futsal Club
description: Futsal is a 5-aside indoor pitch played Football Sport, which rules are governed by the FIFA-UEFA associations. Unlimited substitutions are permitted. Unlike some other forms of indoor football, the game is played on a hard court surface delimited by lines (walls or boards are not used). Futsal is also played with a smaller ball (size 4) with less bounce than a regular football. The surface, ball and rules create an emphasis on improvisation, quick thinking, creativity and technique as well as ball control and passing in small spaces and under pressure.If you interested in playing Futsal at any level please get in touch and join us in order to enjoy this wonderful sport and have fun creatively in the University.

name: 's Impeccably Tailored Society
description: Southampton University's Impeccably Tailored Society is a group who enjoy dressing up smart and taking part in all sorts of activities. Some of our socials include Jazz Nights, Laser Quest, Pub Quizzes, and James Bond Film Nights, all dressed up smart. We also take part in the International Suit Up Day on the 13th of October. Not to be confused by the name, S.U.I.T.S. is a society not exclusive to wearing suits, but to being impeccably dressed, whether male or female. We love to hear from all of our members about new events that we can start, all while we enjoy being impeccably dressed.

name: Spaceflight Society
description: Spaceflight society is an engineering and outreach society, open to anyone who wants to get involved. We carry out high altitude balloon launches and hope to start on rocketry, working closely with schools to teach science and engineering. Opportunities to get involved with electronics, rockets, programming, radio communication, engineering, outreach and physics

name: Spanish, Latin American and Portugese Society
description: SLAPS functions to celebrate and promote the learning of the Hispanic and Lusophone languages and their respective cultures.

name: Squash
description: The squash club are a competitive bunch, but have a huge social and recreational side in addition to our high performing teams. Whether you are a complete beginner or seasoned pro, there's something for everyone with plenty of quality coaching, competition and epic nights out!

name: Sri Lanka Society
description: Southampton University Sri Lankan Society was founded in 2003 to provide the opportunity for individuals from all cultures to meet, interact and learn about Sri Lankan culture and heritage.The society represents the Sri Lankan community at the University of Southampton, giving the chance for societies to unite and work together to achieve a common goal.

name: St. John Ambulance LINKS / First Aid Society
description: LINKS is the student branch of St John Ambulance. We provide First Aid training and assessment to the students of Southampton University, as well as providing First Aid cover to events in and around the local community. For those who do not wish to act as a part of St John Ambulance, we exist also as the "University of Southampton First Aid Society" to those who simply wish to learn first aid.

name: Stage Technicians' Society
description: The Stage Technicians' Society is a Performing Arts society, focused on backstage craft and technical theatre.

name: Steampunk Society
description: Southampton University  Steampunk Society aims to provide a focal point for Steampunks, Cyberpunks and Dieselpunks at the University of Southampton. Membership of the society is free, and we are open to anyone with an interest in Steampunk, Victoriana, science fiction and retrofuturism, from the simply curious up. We're a social society, and run regular film nights (generally weekly) usually followed by a social. In addition we run other events including music gigs, day trips, LARP events, games nights and and attend steampunk gatherings around the country.This summer (2013) for example, a group of members attended the 'Weekend at the Asylum' event in Lincoln, the largest Steampunk gathering in Europe. We are growing as a society and hope to introduce new things to our program this year, including constructive workshops and a vintage Christmas ball. The wearing of Steampunk  or Victorian clothing is not obligatory!

name: Street Dance Society
description: We are a dance society that runs classes in street dance of varying levels. There are 3 classes per week run by 3 different outside teachers.Classes are held:Monday 6.00 - 7.00 pm - Advanced Hip HopWednesday 3.00 - 4.00 pm - Intermediate Street DanceWedneday 4.00 - 5.00 pm - Beginner Street DanceAll held in the Multipurpose Studio.Please come along to any of the above classes to see if Street Dance is for you!Membership is 10 and each class costs 2.50 with membership and 4 without membership. Membership can be bought in class.

name: Street Sports
description: We're a group of longboarders and skateboarders that cater for many different styles, including street, sliding and racing. We are keen to teach beginners, even if you think you lack the balance and know-how to skate, we can lend you all the equipment and advice you need. We run weekly sessions on Wednesdays and Sundays at 1 o'clock starting from outside the Stag's Head.Membership is only 10 which entitles you to free rental of club gear!

name: String Orchestra
description: SUStrings is a friendly and active string orchestra which was founded to provide string musicians the opportunity to play an extensive and varied repertoire for string orchestra. There are no auditions and anyone who plays the violin, viola, cello or double bass to Grade 5 or above is welcome. We rehearse weekly and perform at least one concert per term and one tour per academic year. Rehearsals: Every Tuesday 7:30-9:30pm EEE Building (32) LT 1015Summer Concert 2013: Friday 7th June, St Albans Church (off Burgess Road), 7:00pm

name: Student Scout And Guide Organisation
description: Southampton University's very own Student Scout and Guide Organisation. We are a social club at Southampton University, made up of all sorts of people but you don't have to actually be involved with Scouting or Guiding to join us! We welcome anyone who is interested in Scouts and Guides. From Camping to Biscuit Decoration Evenings, Campfires to Film Nights, Pub Crawls to Crate Stacking.. We generally do enough activities that one will be right for you !! Join us at The Stile Pub for our weekly meetings at 8pm on Monday evenings. We have a few drinks and a chat / let you know of up coming socials. We will be meeting at 7.45pm outside the Students Union for the first 3 weeks of term to walk up. Otherwise, you can meet us at the pub: The Stile Pub, University Road. Next to the row of banks on campus.

name: Students for Palestine ()
description: Students for Palestine at the University of Southampton is a non-profit, non-religious, and non-politically affiliated student society that is open to absolutely anyone interested in the Palestinian cause. We are committed to raising awareness on the Palestinian issue and culture. We aim to increase support for peace and justice in Palestine and call for the observation of international human rights.

name: SU Singers
description: We are a group of non-auditioned singers who come together to rehearse and learn new music, both traditional and more modern pieces, with the aim of putting on 2-3 concerts a year for people to enjoy

name: Sub-Aqua
description: Dive in the U.K during your degree! A registered BSAC (British Sub-Aqua Club) that accepts other agencies and novice divers alike. Learn to dive or improve your current qualification. Regular social events to meet other like-minded individuals with a passion for discovery and skill improvement.

name: Surf
description: Welcome to the home of Southampton University Surf ClubSuSurf is one of the biggest uni surf clubs in the country with well over 100 members!We regularly run weekend trips to UK surf spots all over the country AND 4 massive abroad trips each year; Morocco at Christmas, Portugal at Easter, France in June and Ireland in September!We also run countless trips to local beaches, if there is surf you can count on someone being at the beach.  If you have any questions get in touch!Be sure to sign up to our mailing list and join our Facebook group to keep fully up to date with all that's going on!

name: Surge Radio
description: Surge is your very own student run radio station. It is free to get involved and the ever-enthusiastic committee are always happy to help train new members and get people involved. Whether you see yourself as the next Zane Lowe, Scott Mills or Annie Mac, you can join our DJ team. We report all the latest news with our News team. You can interview famous names and review albums, games and even restaurants in the Features team. The Speech team are keen to get Radio plays/dramas, debates, sport and current affairs shows off the ground. There is all this and much more so get involved to be part of one of the best experiences you can have at University.

name: SUSUtv
description: Here at SUSUtv we are committed to making shiny new television shows; for the students, by the students.Join us and be at the forefront of cutting edge television production.You don't need to be an expert camera operator or a skilled sound technician. All you need is interest, ideas and enthusiasm.So from directing, producing and script writing, to editing and acting, there's loads of opportunities to get involved with SUSUtv.

name: Swimming
description: The Southampton University Swimming Club is a multidimensional club, with competitive and recreational squads catering for swimmers of any ability. We compete in numerous competitions throughout the year and achieve great results in every competition we go to, such as BUCS (British University College Sports) nationals, team championships and Varsity. Once a week all our members come together on a Wednesday evening for our memorable socials, which involve many different fancy dresses and activities. Everyone is welcome and is sure to have an incredible time! Once a year we head on tour to a sunny location (including Tenerife, Salou and Lanzarote) for a week of fun, sun and nightlife (and a little bit of swimming). Please join our Facebook page for further information, or contact tm7g11@soton.ac.uk for any queries you may have.

name: Switch Off Society
description: We are a society who aim to raise people's awareness on their energy consumption habits. In particular, we look to lower the power consumed by each hall of residence compared to the previous year.

name: Symphonic Wind Orchestra
description: SUSWO, originally founded by woodwind and brass players at the university, performs a varied and challenging repertoire to a high standard. The orchestra gives a wide range of musicians from across the university the chance to perform in a friendly and talented ensemble.Today the orchestra has approximately fifty members and aims to perform three concerts a year. Members are auditioned at the start of the academic year and the orchestra is run by a committee of students who work closely with conductor Rowan Baker to select a challenging and enjoyable repertoire.

name: Symphony Orchestra
description: SUSO, an entirely student-run and student-funded orchestra, comprises the most talented musicians at the University of Southampton  across all degree programmes  and performs a wide-ranging repertoire of large-scale orchestral works to a high standard.

name: Table Tennis
description: We are a friendly club for both recreational and serious players. There is 2 hour casual session every week, where any standard of player is welcome. We also have both mens and womens team in the BUCS league, run team training and a weekend to the BUCS individual championships. Socials are on a regular basis!

name: Taekwondo Club
description: Mon: 5-7pm, Tues: 4-5:30pm, Wed: 5:30-7pm, Thurs: 4:30-6pmSun: 1-3pm Martial Arts Studio

name: Tap Dance Society
description: We provide three tap classes a week ranging from beginner level to intermediate and advanced level. We participate in the annual Pure Dance show along with competitions including Loughborough and Bucks. We aim to make classes fun and sociable aswell as providing a society that allows members to increase there tap skills.

name: Tchoukball
description: Southampton Stags Tchoukball Club.Tchoukball is a fast paced handball sport that requires agility, technique for shooting, safe hands for catching, and nimble feet for leaping. The sport is growing rapidly in the UK, with Southampton Stags Tchoukball Club being a major player in the British national league; In the 2012-13 season, Stags claimed the south east regional title, and finished 2nd in a tight national league. The club is essentially one big family of fun and friendly people and happy to welcome anybody to join!

name: Tennis
description: Southampton University Tennis Club is a mixed club which welcomes all abilities from those who have competed at a high national level to those who have never played before. We currently have 2 Mens teams and 1 Ladies team who comprise our Performance squad and they compete in the BUCS leagues (British University and College Sport). We also have an Intermediate Squad which competes in box leagues and our Social tennis which is open to absolutely anyone that fancies a bit of a knock about. We are active on and off the courts and have a great range of socials thanks to our fabulous Social Secs and tours which are both UK- based and overseas. We pride ourselves on the enthusiasm of our club and the sport and welcome all those who want to get involved at any level!

name: The Drum Circle
description: A refuge and sanctuary for foot-tappers, desk-knockers and pencil-rap-a-tatterers alike. We are a new society for people who love rhythm, like drumming, or just enjoy some good old fashioned fun. You don't need any experience - just bring yourself and a drum (or any object that sounds good when you hit it) to our weekly drum circle and join us in collective beat-making. ALL ABILITIES WELCOME.

name: The Melodics
description: This is an acapella vocal group made up of females and males, singing a wide range of songs from pop to musical to classical. It looks at harmonising well known songs and creating interesting arrangements. The aim of this group is to bring life back into music in a unique way.

name: Theatre Group
description: A society to improve theatrical skills through workshops; original writing; producing; directing; and acting. We aim to celebrate creativity in all mediums of drama and to provide all society members with a fun, inclusive environment to further their individual skill sets and to form a community with a love of theatre.

name: Thrift Society
description: ThriftSoc is the society that aims to help students make the most out of their money. We offer our members events at a fraction of the cost you might expect to pay, and provide tips on how to save money in day-to-day life.

name: Touch Rugby
description: University of Southampton Touch Rugby

name: Trampolining
description: SUTC welcome new members of any ability, from complete beginners to those who have been competing for years. We have a number of qualified coaches who can help you to improve. As well as BUCS competitions, we compete all over the UK and Ireland with an annual tour to the Irish Student Trampoline Open

name: Triathlon
description: SUTRI is a friendly club for beginners and experienced triathletes alike.As Southampton University's only multisport club, we take part in both BUCS duathlon and triathlons, along with other races throughout the year.We have tried to make this club as welcoming and accessible as possible. So whatever your fitness and ability, grab your trainers, bike or swimsuit and come and train with us!

name: Unicef on Campus
description: Unicef on Campus is Southampton University's direct link to the great work that UNICEF does worldwide.Our role as a society is to raise awareness of UNICEFs mission and efforts. In addition to raising awareness for children's rights and wellbeing, the society also gets involved in raising money for UNICEF to help them in their work.Our society does everything from hosting socials to putting on concerts to achieve these goals and we have a great atmosphere in our society; lots of fun in a family-like environment to raise money for great causes.

name: Union Films
description: Union Films is the student-run cinema, right on campus in SUSU. We're completely run by volunteers; from the from the front of house staff who sell tickets and refreshments, to the projectionists who show the films on our 35mm and DCI projectors. You can help out as much or as little as you like, and when you do, you get to see films for free!

name: United As One Society
description: United As One Society (U.S.O) aims at promoting the concept of One World, One Love in the University of Southampton. We care about cultures and traditions. Through informal discussions and gatherings on different topics, members not only will have a clearer understanding of others cultures and traditions and have a wider world view of cultural diversity, but most importantly become more open-minded to and appreciate other countries cultures and traditions.

name: Angling Society
description: USAS is a place made for anglers to share knowledge, meet other anglers, boast your catch report and organize trips to local waters. We aim to provide angling opportunities for both beginner and experienced anglers in a social environment - visit the facebook page for more information. Whether you prefer salt water, fresh water or if fly fishing's your game, there's a place for all in USAS!

name: Crossfit and Strength Sports
description: Southampton University Crossfit and Strength Sports is a club dedicated to supporting its members in training and competing in Crossfit, weightlifting, powerlifting and strongman. We run coached sessions and open gym time at the Team Southampton Gym at Wide Lane. We welcome new members of any standard and level of experience - there is no minimum level of strength or skill required - and encourage all to compete in drugs tested federations. We believe that everyone can benefit from lifting heavy things. Why not come along and give it a try?

name: Filipino Society
description: Mabuhay! We are a friendly open society which aims to bring Filipino students together and welcomes people of other nationalities to experience Filipino food, music, movies and so much more, with a long term goal to promote the Philippines and its culture. From food trips to Jam sessions, one can easily feel at home. So join our family, and discover Filipino's best asset, its hospitality.

name: TED Society
description: TED is a non-profit devoted to spreading ideas. It runs annual conferences hosting the eolds most interesting thinkers. The society is to bring together everyone who loves TED and has ideas worth spreading.

name: Vietnamese Society
description: It is a group of Vietnamese people. We try to have activities so that we can know each other better and exchange ideas, knowledge as well as help each other adapt to new environment.

name: Volleyball
description: The SUVC represents the university at various levels of competition in the third most popular team sport in the world. We have both successful men's and ladies teams, consistently reaching high positions in the national rankings, as well as development squads that have successful records in local competitions. We recruit coaches who have experience at the highest levels of volleyball in the country and hold 5 training sessions a week to accommodate the various squads. If your interested in joining us or just have a question find us on Facebook or look out for the SUVC stall at the bunfight in the Jubilee sports hall.

name: Wakeboarding
description: Whether you're a seasoned pro or a complete beginner, SUWake is the best way to get out on the water. We run weekly trips to our local cable JB Ski for insaneely cheap. We also occasionaly visit other cable around the UK and sometimes even venture to Thailand or Turkey. We are part of Uniwake and also attend all events run by them with all the other university wakeboarders from around the country.

name: Water Polo Club
description: At SUWPC there are two mens and two womens sides, both of which are very committed to training and developing, but happy to help those new to the sport. The club also has a very healthy social atmosphere. Waterpolo is a fantastic game that involves strength and a love of water, come along and try it out!Our sessions are:WEDS8-9pm (GIRLS)9-10pm (BOYS)SUNDAY8-9pm(BOYS)9-10pm (GIRLS)

name: WaterAid Society
description: The aims of Southampton University WaterAid would be to promote the work of WaterAid through fundraising and campaigning activities.

name: Wessex Films
description: Wessex Films is an award-winning filmmaking society. We are dedicated to facilitating practical filmmaking for all our members. And provide tuition for a variety of fundamental practises through exciting workshops and tutorials during the entire academic year. We host meetings every Wednesday and all sorts of thrilling socials in between. Whether you'd like to write, act, edit, direct, operate cameras, work special effects, compose music, record foley, storyboard, create concept artwork or more, there's plenty of opportunities to pursue. We welcome all levels and abilities, with no previous experience required. So if you're passionate about film, why not get involved?

name: Wessex Motor Club
description: Wessex Motor Club is a club for motorsport enthusiasts at the University of Southampton. We run and compete in various navigational road events in and around the Southampton area. We also run the UoS Karting Championship and enter two teams in the British University Karting Championship (BUKC) every year. You don't need to have a car to be able to join in- you don't even have to be able to drive!

name: Wessex Sailing Club
description: Wessex Sailing Club is the home of sailing at the University of Southampton. We are one of the largest and most successful clubs in the AU. We have medalled at BUCS championships consecutively since their inception. Alongside our formidable success we also run casual and beginners sessions in both yachts and dinghies which is supported by Southampton's in-house RYA training centre that teaches a wide spectrum of RYA courses from Level One to Yachtmaster. The fun and social atmosphere of the club, backed up by first rate facilities and an outstanding location will mean that you get the best out of your sailing whatever your standard.

name: Wessex Scene
description: The Wessex Scene is the official student publication of Southampton University. We cover a huge range of topics, and any student here is welcome to write for us. Email the editor if you want a writers account, or like us on Facebook and join our writers group to get going. The Scene is a friendly, welcoming society that is the perfect platform for getting involved in journalism or writing, with no previous experience required.

name: Wildlife Protection
description: Wildlife Protection Society's objectives are to raise awareness of the need to protect wildlife, both for students and the general public. To do this there will be a variety of events such as talks, workshops on how to create 'homes' for nature and educations trips. Additionally we will get involved in habitat surveying, which will teach members field skills whilst helping to monitor biodiversity in Southampton.

name: Windsurfing
description: Southampton University Windsurfing Club is the oldest and most experienced student windsurfing club in the UK. We have one of the largest memberships of any university windsurfing club and provide opportunities for all abilities and backgrounds.

name: Wireless Society
description: The Southampton University Wireless Society (SUWS) is the university base for all things regarding amateur radio and wireless communications. Topics and interests vary from shortwave listening, HF/VHF transmission and data-mode reception. Regular outings are organised to participate in contests and volunteering. SUWS is also responsible for the upkeep of the university club callsign G3KMI.SUWS incorporates the Southampton Open Wireless Network (SOWN): an ongoing project which aims to build a free-to-use wireless network surrounding the Southampton area. Anyone is welcome to join in and start setting up additional coverage for their specific area.Meetings are every Thursday 6pm, at the Zepler CLS.

name: Yoga Society
description: We run yoga classes for students and non students at all levels on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday from 6-7.30pm in 32/3077. Classes are 5 each.

name: Zumba+
description: ZUMBA, THE DANCE FITNESS CRAZE THAT HAS TAKEN THE WORLD BY STORM HAS NOW TAKEN OVER UoS. COME AND JOIN US TO SEE WHAT ALL THE FUSS IS ABOUT!!!PLEASE JOIN THE FACEBOOK GROUP 'SOUTHAMPTON UNIVERSITY ZUMBA+ SOCIETY' OR EMAIL FOR MORE INFO. www.facebook.com/groups/southamptonuniversityzumbasociety/CLASSES: MONDAYS AND WEDNESDAYS (ZUMBA), 2-3pm; FRIDAYS (BOKWA) 2-3pm). All classes are in THE CUBE. **Evening classes coming soon!!** 2 members; 3 non-members. Membership is 5 for the whole year and gives you: 1 cheaper classes every time, a stamp card giving you every 6th class free when you have 5 stamps, 10% of society kit and merchandise and a free drink on socials.PLEASE CHECK THE FACEBOOK GROUP AND YOUR EMAILS IF YOU ARE ON THE MAILING LIST FOR ALL UPDATES.So what is this all about anyway?!Zumba+ Society incorporates both Zumba and Bokwa fitness classes, but because of the + in the name, it also has the capacity to expand further to include different classes. Zumba is an mixture between dance and aerobics exercise that has taken the world by storm, attracting millions of people worldwide. It is an easy, and more importantly extremely fun way to keep fit. It is available to everyone and anyone can attend  everyone who does it falls in love with Zumba! Bokwa is similar in that it also combines dance and aerobic exercise, but it works out the lower body more intensely while Zumba focuses on the upper body. Bokwa is a new phenomena; it has only become really known at all in the last year or so and is slowly speading around the world  apparently it is set to be as big and popular as Zumba now is. Our classes dont require much time, effort or money and are an ideal break from work. They are an excellent way to keep fit, make friends and have a great time!
